ResourceHeader.Description: Data follow a 4-second cadence when MAVEN is at an altitude of less than 500 km, otherwise the time cadence is 8 seconds. The in situ key parameters contain 235 parameters selected by the instrument leads and other MAVEN scientists. These data consist of values derived from L2 data provided by the in situ instruments.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: >Principal Investigator : David L. Mitchell, SSL, Berkeley

AccessURL.Name: CDPP/AMDA HAPI Server
AccessURL.Description: Web Service to this product using the HAPI interface.

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: Thank you for acknowledging the use of AMDA in publications with wording like "Data analysis was performed with the AMDA science analysis system provided by the Centre de Données de la Physique des Plasmas (CDPP) supported by CNRS, CNES, Observatoire de Paris and Université Paul Sabatier, Toulouse".. See the Rules of the road at http://amda.cdpp.eu/help/policy.html. Please acknowledge the Data Providers.

AccessURL.Name: CDPP/AMDA Web application
AccessURL.Description: Access to Data via CDPP/AMDA Web application.

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: Thank you for acknowledging the use of AMDA in publications with wording like "Data analysis was performed with the AMDA science analysis system provided by the Centre de Données de la Physique des Plasmas (CDPP) supported by CNRS, CNES, Observatoire de Paris and Université Paul Sabatier, Toulouse".. See the Rules of the road at http://amda.cdpp.eu/help/policy.html. Please acknowledge the Data Providers.

Parameter.Name: density
Parameter.Description: Density of solar wind or magnetosheath electrons based on moments of the electron distribution after correcting for the spacecraft potential

Parameter.Name: temperature
Parameter.Description: Temperature solar wind or magnetosheath electrons based on moments of the electron distribution after correcting for the spacecraft potential

Parameter.Name: parallel flux 5-100 eV
Parameter.Description: Electron energy flux parallel to the magnetic field vector (0-90 degrees pitch angle)

Parameter.Name: parallel flux 100-500 eV
Parameter.Description: Electron energy flux parallel to the magnetic field vector (0-90 degrees pitch angle)

Parameter.Name: parallel flux 500-1000 eV
Parameter.Description: Electron energy flux parallel to the magnetic field vector (0-90 degrees pitch angle)

Parameter.Name: anti-parallel flux 5-100 eV
Parameter.Description: Electron energy flux anti-parallel to the magnetic field vector (90-180 degrees pitch angle)

Parameter.Name: anti-parallel flux 100-500 eV
Parameter.Description: Electron energy flux anti-parallel to the magnetic field vector (90-180 degrees pitch angle)

Parameter.Name: anti-parallel flux 500-1000 eV
Parameter.Description: Electron energy flux anti-parallel to the magnetic field vector (90-180 degrees pitch angle)

Parameter.Name: spectrum shape
Parameter.Description: Energy spectrum shape parameter used to distingush between ionospheric photoelectrons and solar wind electrons
